text:
What would happen to your content budget if we moved into a recession next year? I know a lot of companies ramped up their digital marketing during COVID but do we have anyone in here at a company that didn't?

I haven't been in the content world very long so I'm curious if the demand has been here all along and it just seems like a lot since I'm just discovering it, or is content just booming right now and there is potential for a correction?

I know nobody can predict the future, but let's say your industry experiences a down-turn in the next 12 months. Does your company continue with their content efforts or scale back? Anyone been in content through a recession prior to the COVID crash?
